intro: Cissampelos truncata, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Its rapid growth and ability to climb make it a common ornamental plant in warm climates. The botanical features of Cissampelos truncata make it both ecologically significant and useful in herbal remedies.
